revised_title: Chinese Astronomy and the Lunar Year
tldr: The article discusses the Chinese knowledge of astronomy before the introduction of the science by Arabians and European missionaries. It explains the Chinese lunar year, their zodiac, and the 24 divisions of half moons. The author also mentions the similarities between Chinese and Egyptian cultural practices, such as the annual festival marking the beginning of the lunar year.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Cultural practices and history
